response:
Bilateral spasticity with brisk reflexes and extensor plantars indicates bilateral corticospinal involvement. Primary position torsional nystagmus, bilateral intention tremor/dysmetria, severe bilateral ptosis with complex ophthalmoplegia and dilated pupils localise to the midbrain tegmentum affecting oculomotor nuclei/fascicles and cerebellar outflow while also involving cerebral peduncles. Distal symmetric loss of vibration/JPS/pinprick suggests a concurrent length‑dependent peripheral neuropathy.

lesion_locations = ["bilateral midbrain tegmentum", "bilateral length-dependent peripheral polyneuropathy"]
